ns2:group.ns2:title: M5 iPad Pro First Impressions: Here's What's New!
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Apple just announced the new iPad Pro with the M5 chip ‚Äî and I‚Äôve got the 13-inch 512 GB model in Space Black to test. In this hands-on first look I walk through what‚Äôs new: the M5 chip (up to 15% faster CPU, 35% faster GPU), the new Wi-Fi 7/N1 chip, the C1X modem, faster SSD, updated RAM options, and more.
I‚Äôll dive into the real-world performance comparisons vs the previous gen (M4), including Geekbench results. Plus I‚Äôll cover whether the upgrade is worth it if you already own an iPad Pro.
üëâ If you‚Äôre curious about how the M5 handles AI tasks, external displays, fast charging, or large-file workflows ‚Äî drop a comment below and I‚Äôll include those tests in the full review.

Experimentation Culture is a limited video series that focuses on how organizations have been able to unlock invention by adopting a culture of experimentation. Each short episodic journey works backwards from a specific company introducing who they are and what they do, explains a persistent business problem they had or new experience they wanted to conceive, and walks though how they worked with AWS prototyping team to validate their ideas and successfully bring it to their customers.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Best practices for optimizing Amazon Neptune database | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Best practices for optimizing Amazon Neptune database | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Neptune Performance Optimization: A Technical Guide
This technical walkthrough demonstrates practical approaches to optimizing Amazon Neptune database clusters, focusing on key architectural components and operational efficiency.
Key Topics Covered: ‚Ä¢ Buffer cache configuration and management ‚Ä¢ Worker thread optimization for improved parallel processing ‚Ä¢ Cluster scaling strategies for varying workloads ‚Ä¢ Critical CloudWatch metrics for performance monitoring
The video examines common operational scenarios that organizations encounter when running Neptune at scale, providing specific solutions through: ‚Ä¢ Performance metric analysis ‚Ä¢ Proactive monitoring techniques ‚Ä¢ Resource utilization optimization ‚Ä¢ Capacity planning methodologies
Practical demonstrations show how to: ‚Ä¢ Interpret and respond to CloudWatch metrics ‚Ä¢ Identify potential performance bottlenecks ‚Ä¢ Implement appropriate scaling solutions ‚Ä¢ Monitor cluster health effectively
This technical overview is relevant for database administrators, cloud architects, and engineers who manage graph database infrastructures supporting production workloads.
Topics are applicable across various use cases, including: ‚Ä¢ Network analysis applications ‚Ä¢ Recommendation systems ‚Ä¢ Identity graph management ‚Ä¢ Fraud detection platforms
Learn more at: http://go.aws/3WLuxV4

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Visualizing your graph (and more) using Graph Explorer! | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Visualizing your graph (and more) using Graph Explorer! | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Neptune Graph Explorer: Enhancing Graph Database Exploration
This video walks through the key capabilities of Neptune Graph Explorer, focusing on features designed to streamline graph database operations and improve productivity.
Key Highlights: ‚Ä¢ Query Editor Support: Work efficiently with both Gremlin and openCypher query languages using an editor equipped with syntax highlighting and auto-completion ‚Ä¢ Customizable Visualization: Adapt graph visualizations to your needs with configurable icons and display options ‚Ä¢ Simplified Deployment: Quick setup process to help teams start working with their graph data ‚Ä¢ Multiple View Options: Switch between different visualization layouts and data presentation formats to better understand data relationships
Exciting Roadmap Preview: Get a sneak peek at upcoming features that will revolutionize your graph database experience: ‚Ä¢ SPARQL query editor integration ‚Ä¢ Natural language querying capabilities ‚Ä¢ Graph data editing tools
This tool is particularly relevant for: ‚Ä¢ Enterprise architects working with complex data relationships ‚Ä¢ Research teams analyzing interconnected datasets ‚Ä¢ Development teams building graph-based applications ‚Ä¢ Data scientists exploring network structures
Learn more at: http://go.aws/4ov5eCs

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Volkswagen AG scales innovation across 100 plants with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Volkswagen AG scales innovation across 100 plants with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Volkswagen AG operates more than 100 plants worldwide ‚Äî each with unique data, systems, and challenges. By standardizing on Amazon DataZone and leveraging more than 200 AWS services including Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift, Amazon QuickSight, Amazon Bedrock, and Amazon Q, the company has created a unified platform to seamlessly share data, scale solutions, and accelerate innovation. With the addition of the Amazon SageMaker catalog, Volkswagen AG is delivering value to customers faster, more efficiently, and with less operational effort.
Learn more on how Volkswagen is innovating with AWS: http://go.aws/49ej5Zu

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Big Idea Funding Forest Conservation | Andika Putraditama | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Big Idea Funding Forest Conservation | Andika Putraditama | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Palm oil is in nearly every commodity you use ‚Äî food, shampoo, makeup and more ‚Äî but harvesting this essential material has contributed to the destruction of millions of hectares of forests globally. Sustainability leader Andika Putraditama shares how a groundbreaking collaboration between conservationists and global brands is turning this crisis on its head, unlocking a new model for forest preservation. Discover a vision for preserving the forests still standing and restoring the ones we‚Äôve lost. (Recorded at TED Countdown: Overcoming Dilemmas in the Green Transition on October 30, 2024)
Join us in person at a TED conference: https://tedtalks.social/events Become a TED Member to support our mission: https://ted.com/membership Subscribe to a TED newsletter: https://ted.com/newsletters
Follow TED! X: https://www.twitter.com/TEDTalks Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ted Facebook: https://facebook.com/TED LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ted-conferences TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@tedtoks
The TED Talks channel features talks, performances and original series from the world's leading thinkers and doers. Subscribe to our channel for videos on Technology, Entertainment and Design ‚Äî plus science, business, global issues, the arts and more. Visit https://TED.com to get our entire library of TED Talks, transcripts, translations, personalized talk recommendations and more.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Jeff Su]Steal the Productivity System I Taught to 6,642 Googlers

ns2:group.ns2:title: Steal the Productivity System I Taught to 6,642 Googlers
ns2:group.ns2:description:
üìë¬†My blogpost on the CORE #workflow: https://www.jeffsu.org/i-taught-6-642-googlers-this-productivity-system
I'm sharing the exact #productivity system I taught to over 6,600 Google employees over nine years.
The CORE workflow handles all four types of workplace information through a simple four-step process: Capture everything immediately, Organize with minimal friction, Review during scheduled sessions, and Engage by blocking time to execute.
Trust me when I tell you it works with any tool you already use and becomes automatic within two weeks. No more relying on memory or willpower alone!
*TIMESTAMPS* 00:00 The Productivity System I Taught at Google 00:28 The Basics 01:05 The CORE Workflow in Action 02:50 Why This Works 04:10 Breaking Down the CORE Workflow 06:53 Recap of My Productivity System

*BUILD A POWERFUL WORKFLOW* üìà¬†The¬†Workspace Academy - https://academy.jeffsu.org/workspace-academy?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=video&utm_campaign=191 ‚úçÔ∏è My Notion Command Center - https://www.pressplay.cc/link/s/DE1C4C50
*BE MY FRIEND:* üìß Subscribe to my newsletter - https://www.jeffsu.org/newsletter/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=video&utm_campaign=description üì∏ Instagram - https://instagram.com/j.sushie ü§ù LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/jsu05/

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]The new Xbox is not an Xbox | The Vergecast

ns2:group.ns2:title: The new Xbox is not an Xbox | The Vergecast
ns2:group.ns2:description:
We‚Äôre very bullish on the handheld future of gaming. But we‚Äôre not bullish on the new ROG Xbox Ally. The Verge‚Äôs Sean Hollister joins the show to explain why this Xbox-branded device barely feels like an Xbox, and why it‚Äôs definitely not a threat to the Steam Deck, before he and David debate whether the future of Xbox is even in good hands. After that, The Verge‚Äôs Hayden Field walks David through a couple of important recent studies, asking the same basic question: is AI making us dumb? Finally, Sean returns to answer a question from the Vergecast Hotline (call 866-VERGE11 or email vergecast@theverge.com!) about hybrid computers, which are an extremely 2012 idea and also maybe the future of computing. But probably not. #Vergecast #Technology #Podcast
0:00 Intro 2:02 The Xbox Ally and Ally X with The Verge's Sean Hollister 06:01 Xbox Ally and Ally X Pros and Cons 11:13 First User Experience: Windows Setup Frustrations 12:53 Why Steam Deck Still Wins on Simplicity 13:15 UI/UX Disappointments 15:45 How They Compare to Other Devices 16:31 Would You Buy It Over Other Handhelds? 18:31 Is Microsoft's Vision for Handheld Gaming Even Possible? 21:12 Why the PC Console Ecosystem ‚ÄúWorks‚Äù (Sort Of) 24:45 Microsoft's Strategic Crossroads: What's Next? 25:56 Nintendo Switch 2 and Third-Party Games 28:43 Should I Buy a Steam Deck? (Handheld Buying Advice) 34:08 Segment 2: AI Is Making Us Stupid? 36:09 AI/Brain Study and Results 38:24 What Did the Research Actually Find? 44:47 How Tech and AI Change Cognitive Skills 54:19 Is Losing Old Skills Bad or Just Different? 58:45 Who Should Take Responsibility for Tech‚Äôs Effects? 01:01:10 Faking Book Reports & How Teachers Are Adapting 01:03:08 Can AI Be a True Learning Tool? 01:10:28 Vergecast Hotline

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Practice Makes Fluent - Lifelong Learning]The Complete 3-Hour English Immersion: 500 Practical Conversations

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Complete 3-Hour English Immersion: 500 Practical Conversations
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Want to boost your English understanding and fluency? This video gives you 3 hours of nonstop listening practice with 300 everyday conversations. By making it part of your daily routine, you‚Äôll steadily build confidence and improve your communication skills. Use this video to: * Sharpen your listening ability * Start thinking in English * Respond more quickly in conversations * Pick up useful expressions for daily situations Listen anytime, as often as you like.Make it a regular habit, and you‚Äôll soon find yourself speaking English more smoothly and naturally.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [MacRumors]iOS 26.1 Adds a New ‚ÄúTinted‚Äù Liquid Glass Option

ns2:group.ns2:title: iOS 26.1 Adds a New ‚ÄúTinted‚Äù Liquid Glass Option
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Apple just added a new Liquid Glass ‚ÄúTinted‚Äù option in iOS 26.1 beta, giving users a way to make the interface more opaque and easier to read. If you‚Äôre on the latest iOS 26.1 developer beta, head to Settings ‚Üí Display & Brightness ‚Üí Liquid Glass, and you‚Äôll now see the new ‚ÄúTinted‚Äù setting. This update adjusts the look of the UI in both light and dark mode, reducing transparency for Lock Screen notifications, menus, and navigation bars. The change improves readability and contrast while keeping the same overall iOS 26 design.
üëâ iOS 26.1 beta 4 is currently for developers only, but a public beta should arrive soon, with a full release expected later this October.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]The official Haribo gummy bear battery that's sweeping the ultralight backpacking and hiking world!

ns2:group.ns2:title: The official Haribo gummy bear battery that's sweeping the ultralight backpacking and hiking world!
ns2:group.ns2:description:
It's the official Haribo gummy bear battery that's sweeping the ultralight backpacking and hiking world! Could it truly be the lightweight champ? I put the 10,000mAh (36Wh) version to the test against the lightest from Nitecore and Iniu, and I know which I'd recommend!

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Emerging Science of Finding Critical Metals | Mfikeyi Makayi | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Emerging Science of Finding Critical Metals | Mfikeyi Makayi | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Your smartphone, computer and electric car all depend on one thing ‚Äî critical minerals buried deep underground. But there‚Äôs a catch: the mining industry has gotten dramatically worse at discovering new deposits just when we need them most, says mining innovator Mfikeyi Makayi. She introduces new AI-powered technology that could fix this problem by predicting mineral locations 10,000 times faster than conventional methods and transforming an industry essential to a sustainable future. (Recorded at TED Countdown Summit 2025 on June 18, 2025)
